text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response thoroughly analyzes procedural risks specific to simultaneous cross-border litigation across the three specified jurisdictions (UK, Germany, California). It explicitly addresses inconsistent judgments, preclusion issues, service/evidence gathering constraints (implicitly via discovery/evidence sections), and privilege/data transfer constraints (citing GDPR/UK GDPR). Specifically, it mentions the lack of automatic lis pendens in the UK post-Brexit, the judge-led nature of German proceedings contrasting with expansive US discovery, and the spoliation/sanctions risk in California. It cites relevant rules like CPR, ZPO, and FRCP/CCP, fulfilling all components of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "b334b6cf-6a8a-4036-91d3-5dc65bb28b02"}
